abstract.p: Ireland's Saw Doctors will perform at Tradewinds Concert Center Club in Sea Bright, NJ (S)

block.p: Considered the modern heirs to U2's legacy, and Ireland's E-Street Band, the Saw Doctors are a rough and ready outfit who combine melodic pop, blue-collar grit and a punk spirit resulting in a vigorous collection of Irish roots-rock.
The Roman Catholic Church tried to ban their debut single, ''I Usedta Love Her,'' about lust at Mass, but the record sold well.

Considered the modern heirs to U2's legacy, and Ireland's E-Street Band, the Saw Doctors are a rough and ready outfit who combine melodic pop, blue-collar grit and a punk spirit resulting in a vigorous collection of Irish roots-rock.
The Roman Catholic Church tried to ban their debut single, ''I Usedta Love Her,'' about lust at Mass, but the record sold well.
The group's song themes range from immigrants facing homesickness to first kisses. An ad campaign for Harp Lager to bring them to the American consciousness.
An interesting group of acoustic-based lads from County Galway, the Saw Doctors will cut it up Wednesday, at Tradewinds Concert Center Club, 1331 Ocean Avenue, Sea Bright, (908) 842-7300.
